title: 5 Investment Strategies for Beginners
summary: Diversification is the strategy of spreading an investment across multiple asset classes, industries, and company sizes to reduce risk. Equity investments (also known as stocks) are a riskier type of investment that grows as the company behind the stock grows. Debt investments are safer investments that are not directly tied to the success of a company. Mutual funds are a great way to get started investing if you're a beginner. Robo-advisors are online investment advisors that use algorithms and automated investment strategies to help manage your money.

intro.compiledSource: const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,"When you first start investing, the world of finance can feel like a labyrinth. There are so many different things to consider when choosing the best way to grow your money. The last thing you need is another complicated puzzle to solve. Luckily, as an investor newbie, you have a massive advantage over other beginners who may not be reading financial advice websites: You know you need to invest! While that sounds obvious, plenty of people either don\u2019t understand the importance of investing early or simply don\u2019t get around to it because it feels so daunting and complicated. But hey, we all begin somewhere. If you\u2019re just beginning your journey into the world of investments -- or want to take your game up a level from casual interest to serious financial strategy -- here are some useful tips for getting started in the world of investment and how you can get ahead sooner rather than later with these 5 investment strategies for beginners:"))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

content.compiledSource: const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("h2",null,"Diversification is your best friend"),mdx("p",null,"When you\u2019re first getting started with investing, you\u2019ll hear the term \u2018diversification\u2019 a lot. Diversification is the strategy of spreading an investment across multiple asset classes, industries, and company sizes to reduce risk. A good way to think about diversification is to imagine you have a savings account with a particular bank. If that bank goes out of business, you\u2019ll lose all of your money. Whereas if you have money in multiple banks, you\u2019ll have a much better chance of not losing everything. The same applies with investing in different types of assets. If you put all of your eggs in one basket, such as investing in one single company or industry, you\u2019re risking it all if that company goes out of business or that industry experiences a downswing. Diversification helps you spread the risk and protects your overall portfolio."),mdx("h2",null,"Get to know the difference between equity and debt investments"),mdx("p",null,"You may have noticed the word \u2018equity\u2019 popping up when you\u2019re reading up on different investment types. Equity investments (also known as stocks) are a riskier type of investment that grows as the company behind the stock grows. When you invest in a company\u2019s stock, you\u2019re buying a share of that company. This means that if that company is doing well, your investment will also increase in value. However, if the company is struggling, you\u2019ll likely see your investment decrease in value. The other main type of investment is debt. Debt investments are safer investments that are not directly tied to the success of a company. If the company does well, you may see a small increase in your investment, but it\u2019s not guaranteed. Debt investments are great for financial stability and offer a reliable return, but usually come with lower investment returns than equity investments."),mdx("h2",null,"The power of compound interest"),mdx("p",null,"Compound interest is one of the most powerful and important concepts in finance. Basically, it means that as interest accumulates on your initial investment, it earns even more interest itself. Think of it as your interest earning interest. Compound interest is an extremely helpful tool for showing the growth potential of your investments and is one of the key advantages of investing early. If you begin investing in your 20s, compound interest has a ton of time to work its magic and make your investment grow much bigger than if you begin in your 30s or 40s."),mdx("h2",null,"Mutual funds are a great starting point for beginners"),mdx("p",null,"Mutual funds are a great way to get started investing if you\u2019re a beginner. A mutual fund is a combination of different types of investments (like stocks and bonds) that are managed by a professional fund manager who picks the best investments for your particular fund. Investing in a mutual fund is a relatively simple way to diversify your portfolio and get started with investing. There are tons of different types of mutual funds, so you can get started with different types of investments to suit your risk tolerance and financial situation."),mdx("h2",null,"Don\u2019t forget about ETFs"),mdx("p",null,"Exchange-traded funds (ETFs) are similar to mutual funds, but they are less diversified and have a lower minimum investment requirement. This makes them a good investment choice for beginners, and they are also popular among experienced investors because they are low-cost and have little risk of loss."),mdx("p",null,"ETFs are baskets of different assets that are traded on the stock market like stocks. They typically track an index like the S&P 500, which means that they follow the movements of the 500 largest companies in the U.S. economy."),mdx("p",null,"The advantage of ETFs over mutual funds is that each ETF comes with a detailed description of exactly what it is invested in. This makes it easier for new investors to understand exactly what they are buying."),mdx("h2",null,"Robo-Advisors are worth your consideration"),mdx("p",null,"Robo-advisors are online investment advisors that use algorithms and automated investment strategies to help manage your money. Going with a robo-advisor is one of the simplest ways to start investing and they\u2019re a great option for beginners since there\u2019s no minimum investment required and they often have low fees."),mdx("p",null,"Like mutual funds, robo-advisors use algorithms based on risk assessment to help diversify your portfolio and pick the best investment options for you. You can also often set up automatic transfers from your bank account to make investing easy and painless."),mdx("p",null,"Depending on which robo-advisor you choose, you may be able to choose from a variety of types of investment, including mutual funds and ETFs. Robo-advisors make investing easy for beginners by offering simplified investment options that are easy to understand."),mdx("h2",null,"Bottom line"),mdx("p",null,"When you\u2019re just starting out, the best thing you can do is keep it super simple. Don\u2019t get caught up in all the different types of investments out there. Instead, focus on the ones that are easiest for you to understand."),mdx("p",null,"Also, remember that investing is a long-term game. It\u2019s not a sprint, it\u2019s a marathon. While you want to aim for high returns, don\u2019t get too caught up in day-to-day fluctuations. Instead, keep your eye on the big picture and keep investing regularly."),mdx("p",null,"If you keep these 5 investment strategies for beginners in mind, you\u2019ll have a strong foundation to build upon and be well on your way to successful investing."))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: Best Investment Strategies to Generate Passive Income

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`Thinking of investing to accumulate wealth and generate passive income? Passive income is a broad term that encompasses any income you receive from an investment, venture, or business that requires little maintenance. Passive income is the Holy Grail for personal finance, because it allows you to make money while not actively working. It\u2019s the ultimate goal for most investors.
Researchers suggest that passive income will be the primary source of retirement funding for millennials. However, this financial strategy isn\u2019t easy for everyone, especially with so many different ways to invest your money and get a return on your investment. If you\u2019re considering starting your own business or launching a side hustle to generate passive income streams, here are some trusted strategies that may suit your risk profile and goals.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: How to Pick the Best Stocks for Your Portfolio

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:o,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:o,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`New investors often struggle with how and where to invest their money. There are so many stock marketplaces, brokerages, and investment options that it can be overwhelming. However, picking the right stocks is important\u2014your portfolio will largely be made up of stocks for a reason. The market may fluctuate rapidly, but your financial future rests on sound investments.
Let\u2019s take a look at some tips for picking the best stocks for your portfolio in any market. Your stock portfolio may seem like an unchangeable part of your financial plan, but it\u2019s actually one of the most flexible components. Once you know what kind of risk profile you\u2019re comfortable with and which industries or sectors you want to invest in, you\u2019ll have a clearer picture of what kind of stocks to buy. Here\u2019s what you need to know about picking the best stocks for your portfolio:`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: The Best Ways to Invest Your Money and Get the Most Out of It

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`When it comes to money, everyone has something to say. Everyone also has a different opinion on how you should spend, save and invest it. Let\u2019s face it \u2013 with so much advice out there, it can be hard to know what to do with your cash. But when you think about it, that\u2019s exactly why we\u2019re here \u2013 to help you find the best way forward for your needs. Because whether you have a small amount or a larger sum of money available right now, the sooner you start investing wisely the better off you\u2019ll be in the long run.
We all want financial security and a comfortable retirement some day \u2014 but not many people are willing to put in the time and effort required to get there. That\u2019s why we\u2019ve got all the information you need right here so that you can start making smart decisions today and build a better financial future tomorrow.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: How to Build a Diversified Investment Portfolio
Investing for Beginners - Where to Start

intro.compiledSource: const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,"You can either love it or hate it. But investing is something that we all have to deal with at some point in our lives. If you\u2019re someone who likes math, logic, and problem-solving \u2013 and doesn\u2019t shy away from risk \u2013 then maybe investing is for you. For the rest of us, however, the idea of investing can seem a little bit scary. But don\u2019t worry; investing is much simpler than most people think, especially if you have a basic understanding of how personal finance works. Keeping a detailed record of your money isn\u2019t difficult and every person should invest their earnings for the future. Whether you have $5 or $500 to invest as a beginner, there are lots of great places to put that money so that it can grow over time. The trick is knowing which investment options are best for you and your circumstances..."))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: What Are No-Load Mutual Funds and Are They Right for You?
Investing for Income - Generating Passive Income

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:o,...e}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...e,components:o,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`When it comes to investing, most people think of stocks and the performance of the market. However, there are many other ways to invest your money and generate income from it. Investing for income means you\u2019re looking for a regular stream of cash from your investments, either as quarterly or annual payments. There are several ways to do this; you just need to know where to look.
Investing for income can be a challenging endeavor, but with the right knowledge you can achieve your goal. If you\u2019re looking for some steady returns on your investment, check out our guide on how to invest for income in a variety of ways that won\u2019t leave you out of pocket and will allow you to continue growing your wealth over time.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: The Benefits of Investing for Retirement

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`The quality of life for most people in their golden years is directly correlated to how well they prepared for retirement. According to a recent report by the National Institute on Retirement Security, as many as one-third of Americans are at risk of being unable to maintain their current standard of living in retirement. That\u2019s because many are not putting away enough money on a regular basis.
An investment strategy that can be useful for helping you achieve your retirement goals is known as "retirement investing." This type of investing is geared toward enabling you to retire sooner with a more comfortable and secure standard of living. If you\u2019re not quite ready to retire but would like to have more financial security once you do, it\u2019s probably time to begin planning for your post-work life. A good place to start is by familiarizing yourself with the many different types of retirement investing available. Understanding these various options along with their pros and cons will help you determine which one(s) might be right for you.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: How to Start Investing with Little Money

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:t,...e}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...e,components:t,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`Unless you\u2019re a trust fund kid or a lottery winner, chances are that you don\u2019t have much cash to invest. As a recent college graduate with student loans and rent to pay, let alone the prospect of saving for retirement, you may think investing feels like an impossible task. But it doesn\u2019t have to be. You just need to know where to start.
Investing can be intimidating at first glance. Even high-net-worth individuals struggle finding trustworthy advisors who specialize in helping those with little capital get started in the market\u2014until now. The following simple strategies will help any investor begin investing with little money and see returns over time. Keep reading for more details and examples of how much you could stand to gain from investing even a small amount now and maintaining that habit for the long term.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;
